reasons_to_visit.details: Experience Gothenburg as it transitions from winter to early spring, with increasing daylight and potentially milder temperatures than inland Sweden. Enjoy major museums and indoor attractions with minimal crowds.
Benefit from lower prices for flights and accommodation compared to peak season, offering better value (outside potential Easter holidays).

Perfect weather to embrace the Swedish tradition of 'fika' – enjoying coffee and pastries (like 'semlor' before Easter) in warm, inviting cafés, particularly in the charming wooden houses of Haga district.
Celebrate Våffeldagen on March 25th! Indulge in traditional heart-shaped Swedish waffles served with jam and cream at cafés across the city.

Ideal conditions for in-depth exploration of Gothenburg's excellent museums like the Maritime Museum, Museum of World Culture, Gothenburg Art Museum, Universeum science center, and Röhsska Museum of Design and Craft.
Depending on conditions early in the month, there might still be opportunities for ice skating at temporary rinks or winter sports at nearby areas like Alebacken if there's sufficient snow.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March remains chilly (avg highs 5-8°C/41-46°F) and weather is highly variable. Gothenburg's west coast location means higher likelihood of rain and wind compared to inland areas, with occasional sleet or wet snow. Requires proper weatherproof layering.
Daylight hours increase significantly throughout March but are still much shorter than summer, limiting time for extensive outdoor exploration.
Gothenburg's southern archipelago is still in winter mode. Ferry services are running but on reduced winter schedules, and many island businesses remain closed until the tourist season.
Being on Sweden's west coast, Gothenburg can experience strong winds and frequent rain showers in March. Good waterproof footwear and rainproof outerwear are essential.
If Easter falls in late March, Good Friday and Easter Monday are public holidays with widespread closures (shops, Systembolaget, some museums/restaurants). Check dates for the year.

weather.precipitation: Transition from winter to early spring. High chance of rain, sometimes mixed with sleet or wet snow. Windy conditions common due to coastal location. Sunny days occur but are often crisp.
weather.general_tips: Pack waterproof clothing: good rainproof jacket, waterproof footwear with good grip, hat, gloves, scarf, and layers to adapt to changing conditions. An umbrella is useful for city exploration.

tourism_level.crowds: Low season continues. Attractions are quiet.
tourism_level.pricing: Generally good value for flights and accommodation.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Late winter feel. Quiet city, focused on indoor activities. Rainy days common, but occasional sunny spells bring locals outside to cafes and parks.

events_holidays.name: Gothenburg International Film Festival (Potential Overlap)
events_holidays.date: Usually late January through early March
events_holidays.description: If extending into March, catch the tail end of Scandinavia's largest film festival, showcasing international and Swedish films at various venues throughout the city.
events_holidays.notes: Check the official festival website for exact dates and program. Many films have English subtitles.

events_holidays.name: Boat Show (Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: Given Gothenburg's maritime heritage, the city may host boat-related exhibitions at Svenska Mässan (The Swedish Exhibition & Congress Centre).
events_holidays.notes: Appeals to boating enthusiasts. Check exact dates and location.

unique_experiences.description: Learn about Gothenburg's rich maritime history and visit the aquarium featuring Nordic sea life without the crowds of peak season.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ideal indoor activity for cold or wet weather. Affordable entry fee.

unique_experiences.description: Explore this large urban park with its small zoo featuring Nordic animals like moose and seals. Beautiful for a walk if weather permits.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry. Dress warmly as it's fully outdoors. The small zoo area remains open year-round.

unique_experiences.where: Cafés throughout Gothenburg, especially in Haga district
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a traditional Swedish coffee break. March is often the last chance to find 'semlor' (Lenten cream buns) in bakeries before Easter.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Haga is famous for its giant cinnamon buns, but many cafes also excel at semlor during season. Cafes like Cafe Husaren are particularly atmospheric.

unique_experiences.description: Escape unpredictable weather in Sweden's largest science center, featuring a multi-level rainforest, aquariums, and interactive exhibits on technology and nature.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Great for families or rainy days. The tropical rainforest section is especially welcome during cold weather.

weather.precipitation: Signs of spring emerge. Rain remains common, but snow becomes less likely. More sunny days, longer daylight hours noticeable.
weather.general_tips: Continue with waterproof outerwear and layers. Temperature fluctuations between morning, afternoon, and evening become more pronounced.

tourism_level.crowds: Remains relatively low, but may see a slight uptick towards Easter if it falls late in the month.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season value continues, watch for potential Easter holiday price increases.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Transition period. Feels less like winter. Brighter days, anticipation of spring. Waffle Day adds a fun local touch.

events_holidays.name: Waffle Day (Våffeldagen)
events_holidays.description: Celebrate the day dedicated to waffles! Cafés and homes serve crispy, heart-shaped Swedish waffles with jam (sylt) and whipped cream (grädde).
events_holidays.notes: Not a public holiday. A fun culinary tradition to participate in. Look for cafes advertising 'Våfflor'.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (Potential - Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: If Easter occurs, Good Friday & Easter Monday are public holidays. Traditions include Easter eggs (often filled with candy), decorations with birch twigs and feathers ('påskris'), and specific foods.
events_holidays.notes: Check dates for the year. Expect closures on public holidays. Museums and Liseberg may have Easter-themed activities if open for the season.

unique_experiences.description: Indulge in delicious Swedish waffles on March 25th. Find a cozy café and enjoy this sweet tradition.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Popular cafes might be busier on this day. Try classic toppings like cloudberry jam ('hjortronsylt').

unique_experiences.description: Wander the charming streets with their wooden houses as spring approaches. Browse boutique shops and enjoy the historic atmosphere.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear good footwear for potentially wet cobblestones. Combine with a visit to nearby Skansen Kronan for city views if weather permits.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Gothenburg Museum of Art
unique_experiences.description: Explore the impressive collection of Nordic and international art, including works by Rembrandt, Picasso, and the Nordic masters.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Located at the top of Avenyn, Gothenburg's main boulevard. Check for current special exhibitions.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a refreshing walk along Gothenburg's historic 17th-century canal system, appreciating the architecture and atmosphere as the days grow longer.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: The route from Brunnsparken along Stora Hamnkanalen past the Opera House offers nice views. Dress for potentially windy conditions near the water.
